p.s: Wautersia (Wau.ter′si.a. L. fem. n. Wautersia named in honour of the Belgian microbiologist Georges Wauters).
Gram-negative rods that are motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Forms smooth colonies that reach 1–2 mm within 48 h at 30 °C on blood agar.
Glucose is neither acidified nor assimilated.
Cellular fatty acids are of the saturated and monounsaturated straight-chain types, mainly C16 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω11c and C14 : 0.
The type species of the genus is Wautersia eutropha.
